channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Belarus Olympian safe in Tokyo hotel after refusing 'forced' flight home
item.description: Krystsina Tsimanouskaya alleges she was almost forced onto a plane home after criticising her coaches.

item.title: Tanker attack: UK and US blame Iran for deadly ship attack
item.description: The UK accuses Tehran of violating international law, while Iran calls the accusations "baseless".

item.title: Turkey: People flee popular tourist spots to escape wildfires
item.description: Footage has emerged showing people fleeing the deadly fires which have engulfed parts of Turkey.

item.title: Sheikh Jarrah: Palestinians await Jerusalem evictions ruling
item.description: The threatened takeover of homes by Jewish settlers in Sheikh Jarrah has stoked Palestinian anger.

item.title: Giant panda twins born in French zoo
item.description: The event is described as "exceptional" by experts, as panda reproduction is notoriously difficult.

item.title: Raven Saunders: What the Olympian's X protest means to her
item.description: The US shot-putter defies a ban on podium gestures after taking silver at the Tokyo Games.

item.title: 'You can be African and black and play polo'
item.description: Molawa Adesuyi is calling for more young people from ethnic minority backgrounds to take up his sport.

item.title: Myanmar: State of emergency extended with coup leader as PM
item.description: Gen Min Aung Hlaing takes on the new title and says emergency rule may last until August 2023.

item.title: DaBaby dropped by US music festival Lollapalooza
item.description: The Chicago festival is the latest to cut ties, after the rapper's derogatory comments about people with HIV.

item.title: Nigeria suspends 'Hushpuppi-linked' police officer Abba Kyari
item.description: The deputy commissioner is indicted in the US for allegedly taking a bribe from an influencer.

item.title: Sky News Australia barred for week by YouTube over Covid misinformation
item.description: The digital giant bans the channel from uploading new content for a week over misinformation breaches.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: 'Can we have two golds?' - high jumpers share win
item.description: An incredible Olympic high jump final ended with both Qatar's Mutaz Essa Barshim and Italy's Gianmarco Tamberi taking gold medals.

item.title: Nigerian student shocked to see friend's body in anatomy class
item.description: Nigerian students often dissect "unclaimed" bodies from mortuaries but some are victims of police violence.

item.title: Iran water: What's causing the shortages?
item.description: Iranian officials have warned of historic drought while experts blame years of poor water management.

item.title: Then and now: The burning issue of wildfires
item.description: Scientists are increasingly concerned climate change is making fires more frequent and more intense.

item.title: Finding answers to the world's drinking water crisis
item.description: Scientists are racing to come up with technologies that can solve the world's clean water shortage.

item.title: Nairobi - the centre of East Africa's thriving arts scene
item.description: Artists from across East Africa have converged on Kenya's capital, creating a vibrant scene.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: The medal winners' flowers that pay tribute to 2011 disaster
item.description: More than 5,000 bouquets are being handed to athletes at the Olympic and Paralympic Games - and have a special significance, with flowers from areas devastated by a 2011 earthquake and tsunami.

item.title: Afghanistan: Orphan's reunion with British soldier after 19 years
item.description: Ramin Paikar was among the orphans visited by British soldiers stationed in Kabul in 2002.

item.title: The women fighting infertility stigma in Nigeria
item.description: Three Nigerian women confront the prejudice they have faced on their fertility journeys.

item.title: ICYMI: Decoding feline feelings and a breathtaking bungee jump
item.description: A round-up of the week's news you might have missed.

item.title: The man who 'killed' Pluto
item.description: How Mike Brown’s discovery of a larger object threatened Pluto’s 75-year status as a planet

item.title: The separated refugees brought back together by judo
item.description: Sanda Aldass and Muna Dahouk have trained together since childhood but the war in Syria separated them.

item.title: Laurel Hubbard: The reluctant history-maker at the centre of sport's transgender debate
item.description: Weightlifter Laurel Hubbard is set to become the first openly transgender athlete to compete in a different gender category to that which they were born at an Olympics.

item.title: Tom Daley knits while watching Olympic springboard final
item.description: Twitter is deluged with images of the Olympian knitting a "purple concoction" in the stands in Tokyo.

item.title: How a trick no woman had done before won a gold
item.description: A trick revered, unexpected and never done by a woman before - what is the backflip 360 pulled off by Charlotte Worthington?

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Namibian athlete says 'You can't tell me now I am not a woman'
item.description: Namibia's Beatrice Masilingi is excited to compete at the Olympics despite being forced out of the 400m due to high levels of testosterone.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Medal table - which country has won most golds?
item.description: Which country is leading the medal table? How are Great Britain getting on? Medals table for the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo.

item.title: Simone Biles criticism baffles Callum Skinner: Mental health 'not death of sport'
item.description: Criticism of Simone Biles for withdrawing from some events at Tokyo 2020 is "baffling", says Olympic gold medallist Callum Skinner.
